question: How many sons did the king have?
answer1: seven

question: How did the king feel about his sons?
answer1: love

question: What happened because the king was so fond of his sons?
answer1: He never could bear to them all away from him at once.
answer2: One of them always had to stay with him.

question: Who did the king want to stay at home?
answer1: the youngest

question: Why did the six sons plan to leave?
answer1: to go forth and look for wives

question: Why did the other sons need to bring home a bride for the youngest?
answer1: The youngest the king wanted to keep at home.

question: What did the king give his six sons?
answer1: the handsomest clothes

question: What happened because the six sons were so deeply in love with their brides?
answer1: They altogether forgot they were also to bring back a princess for their younger brother.

question: Why did the six sons chose the six daughters?
answer1: They were beautiful.

question: What did the clothes do from afar?
answer1: glittered

question: What happened when the six sons and their wives passed a steep cliff-side?
answer1: A giant came out, looked at them, and turned them all to stone.

question: How did the king feel when his sons did not return home?
answer1: very sad

question: Why was the king sad when his sons did not return?
answer1: He loved them very much.

question: What did the youngest want to do?
answer1: set out and find his brothers again

question: Why did the king keep on living?
answer1: He still had his youngest son.

question: What happened because the six sons were given all the good horses?
answer1: The king had only a wretched old nag for the youngest.

question: Who did the youngest meet when he had ridden a while?
answer1: a raven

question: Why was the raven unable to move?
answer1: He was so starved.

question: Why did the king's son agree to help the raven?
answer1: It was easy to see he needed it.

question: What was the salmon doing when the youngest reached the brook?
answer1: gotten on dry land and was threshing about and could not get back into the water

question: What will the wolf ask from the king's son?
answer1: help

question: Why did the prince say no to the wolf?
answer1: He already gave his food away.
answer3: He won't have anything to ride on.

question: What did the wolf offer the prince?
answer1: to let the prince ride on him
answer2: to help in the future when he is need

question: Why was the wolf able to ride swiftly?
answer1: His meal had made the wolf so strong.

question: Where did the wolf take the prince?
answer1: where the giants live

question: What did the prince do after he let the wolf eat the horse?
answer1: took the bit and put it in the wolf's mouth and fastened the saddle on his back

question: Who would tell the prince how to get rid of the giant?
answer1: a princess

question: How did the prince feel to enter the giant's door?
answer1: afraid

question: What did the prince think would happen to him if he entered the giant's home?
answer1: The giant would murder him.

question: Why could no one kill the giant?
answer1: He hasn't his heart about him.

question: What did the princess tell the prince to do?
answer1: crawled under the bed and listen carefully when she talked to the giant

question: Where did the giant keep his heart?
answer1: under the threshold of the door

question: Why did the princess ask the giant where his heart was?
answer1: the prince laid under the bed
answer2: the prince needed to know to kill him

question: What will the prince do after finding out where the giant's heart was?
answer1: look for it

question: What did the giant do the next morning?
answer1: got up very early and went into the forest

question: What did the prince and king's daughter do after the giant left?
answer1: set about looking for the heart under the threshold of the door

question: Why could the prince and king's daughter not find the heart?
answer1: The giant lied.

question: What happened because the king's daughter and the prince could not find the giant's heart?
answer1: They went back to the house.

question: What reason did the princess give the giant for the strewn flowers?
answer1: She was fond of the giant and wanted to decorate the place where his heart lay.
answer2: She liked the giant and wanted to honor where his heart lay.

question: What was the princess doing when she asked where the giant kept his heart?
answer1: sat looking out of the window

question: Why did the giant not want to tell the princess where his heart was kept?
answer1: She could never reach the place where he kept his heart.

question: Why did the giant tell the princess the true location of his heart?
answer1: The giant could no longer resist.

question: Who will help the prince retrieve the giant's heart?
answer1: the wolf

question: Why did the wolf help the prince to the well in the church?
answer1: The prince had helped the wolf before.
answer2: The wolf promised to help the prince.

question: How long did it take to reach the lake?
answer1: many, many days

question: What did the wolf do to get them across the lake?
answer1: swam

question: Why was the king's son not able to get the church-key?
answer1: The church-key hung high in the tower.

question: How was the raven able to retrieve the key?
answer1: He could fly.
answer2: The key was high up and the raven has wings.

question: What happened when the prince grasped and lifted the duck?
answer1: the egg fell into the well

question: What did the giant do when the prince squeezed the egg?
answer1: cried out
answer2: fearfully and tearfully begged for his life

question: Why did the troll agree to turn the princess and brides back?
answer1: He would do all the king's son asked him to if only he would not squeeze his heart in two.

question: How did the king feel when his sons and their brides returned?
answer1: joy

question: How did the king and his sons celebrate when they returned?
answer1: a feast that lasted for weeks
